p: Our results highlighted for the first time the interesting anti-trypanosomal activity of four EOs extracted from Vietnamese plants, C. longa, C. zedoaria, L. cubeba, and Z. officinale. Monoterpenes were major components of L. cubeba EOs, while the three other EOs contained mostly sesquiterpenes. Among the five major compounds of the C. longa EO, curlone was the most active and selective compound. This compound can explain a part of the observed activity of the EO. Its activity should be further investigated in the research for new anti-trypanosomal compounds.
